content.question: Long-term exposure to extended periods of bright light after sunset is most likely to affect a person in which of the following ways?

choices.label: Melatonin synthesis will be increased, and the entire sleep-wake cycle will be shifted by several hours.
Melatonin synthesis will be increased, and the person will quickly fall asleep.
Melatonin synthesis will be inhibited, and the person will have difficulty sleeping.
Melatonin synthesis will be inhibited, and the person will quickly fall asleep.

content.answer: Melatonin synthesis will be inhibited, and the person will have difficulty sleeping.

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
